intro: Alyxia laxiflora, commonly known as the Florida flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Alyxia laxiflora is often found in sandy soils along coastal areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
